questions.text: The new law came into effect ___ January 1st.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'On' is used for specific dates.
Incorrect. 'In' is used for months or years.

questions.text: He acted ___ behalf of the committee.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'On behalf of' means representing someone.

questions.text: The project was completed ___ the expense of quality.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'At the expense of' means with a negative cost or trade-off.

questions.text: She succeeded ___ virtue of her determination.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'By virtue of' means because of.

questions.text: The country is rich ___ natural resources.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'Rich in' means having a lot of something valuable.

questions.text: The research was carried out ___ collaboration with other universities.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'In collaboration with' means working together.

questions.text: The company is divided ___ several departments.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'Divided into' shows separation into parts.

questions.text: He is eligible ___ the scholarship program.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'Eligible for' means qualified to receive something.

questions.text: The judge ruled ___ favor of the defendant.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'In favor of' means supporting or approving.

questions.text: The success of the plan depends ___ careful execution.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'Depend on' means rely on something.

questions.text: She was convicted ___ fraud last year.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'Convicted of' is used in legal contexts.

questions.text: The two companies merged ___ the purpose of expanding abroad.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'For the purpose of' means with the aim of.

questions.text: We acted ___ accordance with the law.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'In accordance with' means following or respecting.

questions.text: The results are consistent ___ previous studies.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'Consistent with' means in agreement with.

questions.text: He spoke ___ length about his experiences abroad.
Her actions were motivated ___ greed.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'Motivated by' expresses the cause or reason.

questions.text: The company specializes ___ renewable energy.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'Specialize in' means focus on a particular area.

questions.text: He succeeded ___ the help of his colleagues.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'With the help of' means using assistance.

questions.text: She’s confident ___ her ability to win the competition.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'Confident in' means having faith in.
Also possible, but 'confident in' fits better with 'ability'.

questions.text: He’s aware ___ the potential risks involved.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'Aware of' means having knowledge about.
Incorrect. 'About' is less formal and incorrect here.

questions.text: The workers are engaged ___ improving production quality.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'Engaged in' means actively involved in something.
